meanings.definition: A division or subdivision of something, typically into smaller sections or groups.
meanings.sent1: The tree's branching provided shade on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The branching of the river created many small streams.
meanings.sent3: The branching of the family tree led to a surprising discovery.
meanings.sent4: The branching of ideas in the meeting sparked creativity.
meanings.sent5: The branching of roads in the forest made navigation challenging.

meanings.definition: The act of diverging or spreading out in different directions.
meanings.sent1: The branching of paths in the garden confused the visitors.
meanings.sent2: The branching of lightning across the sky was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The branching of gossip in the office was hard to keep up with.
meanings.sent4: The branching of cracks on the wall indicated structural issues.
meanings.sent5: The branching of roots in the soil showed the tree's strength.
